author: Gerardo Federico
title: Scotland's 'Chvrches' fills up Fillmore Theater
text:
Chvrches, Scottish electronc band, jams Denver out The trio came down to the Fillmore Theater 4:55 PM, Oct 24, 2015 2 hours ago Previous Next 
DENVER - Scottish electronic band Chvrches (pronounced "Churches") pounded out their unique sound inside the Fillmore Theater supporting their sophomore album "Every Eye Open" to a psyched crowd in Denver on Thursday night. 
The band members consist of Lauren Mayberry on lead vocals, Iain Cook on synthesizers and bass, and Martin Doherty on synthesizers, vocals and samplers. For a 3-piece band, they pound out a lot of sound! 
A rather small framed Mayberry might be small in stature but has a voice that can move mountains and part seas. Her stage presence is something else as well. Backed up by Cook and Doherty, they make a big sound that not very many bands can match. 
They hit the ground running and belted out their debut album staples like "We Sink,""Lies," and "Recover," and had plenty of new material like my favorites "Clearest Blue," and "Leave a Trace." It doesn't matter what song you choose off of any of their albums, you'll find there isn't any of them you don't like! 
Keep an eye out for these guys. When you only have 2 albums out and you're filling up a venue like the Fillmore, you know you're doing something right! Keep it up you three, I see a lot of good things coming your way! 
----
